title: Halliburton Holds All the Pricing Power
sub_head: With shortages driving up the price of oil and oil-field equipment, companies like Halliburton are in a sweet spot. But that might already be baked into the stock price.
body:
With oil prices at eight-year highs and equipment shortages keeping negotiating power on the oil-field-service companiesâ€™ side, Halliburton is having a field day.
The oil-field-services giant had a healthy first quarter, with total revenue increasing 24% compared with a year earlier, above analyst expectations polled by FactSet. Much of that was driven by strong growth in North America. Revenue grew 37% in that region while its international segment saw 15% growth.
